item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 12, 2025 at 1:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Adobe Lightroom's AI Remove feature added a Bitcoin to bird in flight photo (15 points | 7 comments)
2. De-smarting the Marshall Uxbridge (219 points | 66 comments)
3. Cannonball: An Enhanced OutRun Engine (109 points | 4 comments)
4. Track your devices via Apple FindMy network in Go/TinyGo (247 points | 69 comments)
5. Obvious Things C Should Do (63 points | 36 comments)
6. Show HN: TypeScript/React/Vue Window Layout Manager (Tabs, Floating, Popouts) (201 points | 47 comments)
7. What is the future of WiFi (from a network security standpoint) (26 points | 12 comments)
8. Decentralized Syndication – The Missing Internet Protocol (13 points | 11 comments)
9. The Heroic Industry of the Brothers Grimm (31 points | 3 comments)
10. The Tsunami of Burnout Few See (326 points | 203 comments)
11. Stop Trying to Schedule a Call with Me (76 points | 15 comments)
12. Map of California roads for cyclers (1895) (46 points | 20 comments)
13. A visual demo of Ruby's lazy enumerator (87 points | 19 comments)
14. Show HN: 3D Terrain simulation for hiking, skiing etc. (96 points | 35 comments)
15. Ingrid Daubechies Awarded National Medal of Science (122 points | 8 comments)
16. Be Aware of the Makefile Effect (351 points | 278 comments)
17. The engineering behind the San Antonio River Walk (121 points | 20 comments)
18. The Chaos (1922) (69 points | 25 comments)
19. Scanning ultrasound removes amyloid-β, restores memory in Alzheimer mouse model (2015) (73 points | 27 comments)
20. Wends of Texas (51 points | 27 comments)
21. Binary modding a water dispenser to save me from pressing a button (2021) (74 points | 9 comments)
22. Darkest and clearest skies at risk from industrial megaproject (7 points | discuss)
23. /bin/sh: the biggest Unix security loophole (1984) [pdf] (79 points | 37 comments)
24. I Sang Along with Peter Yarrow in 1972 (4 points | 2 comments)
25. Matt Mullenweg deactivates WordPress accounts of contributors planning a fork (239 points | 98 comments)
26. Chatham House Rule is suddenly everywhere in the Bay Area (36 points | 91 comments)
27. JPMorgan Reportedly Ending Remote Work for More Than 300k Employees (50 points | 36 comments)
28. CCL: Categorical Configuration Language (77 points | 33 comments)
29. An Introduction to Neural Ordinary Differential Equations [pdf] (69 points | 4 comments)
30. The Fannie and Freddie trade is back (63 points | 59 comments)
